references.paper_title: Efficient and robust approximate nearest neighbor search using hierarchical navigable small world graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces HNSW, a widely used graph-based approximate nearest neighbor search algorithm that serves as a foundation for many subsequent ANNS algorithms.

references.paper_title: Fast approximate nearest neighbor search with the navigating spreading-out graph
references.reason: This paper introduces the navigating spreading-out graph, a graph-based ANNS method that is compared against the proposed method in this paper and is proven to reduce the overall search cost.

references.paper_title: A comprehensive survey and experimental comparison of graph-based approximate nearest neighbor search
references.reason: This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview and comparison of various graph-based ANNS algorithms, including those used as baselines in this paper’s experiments.

references.paper_title: The relative neighbourhood graph of a finite planar set
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces the Relative Neighborhood Graph (RNG), a proximity graph structure that underlies several ANNS algorithms, including the ones used as baselines in this work.

references.paper_title: Monotonic search networks for computer vision databases
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Monotonic Search Networks (MSNET), a theoretical framework for understanding greedy search, which is closely related to the efficiency analysis of the proposed CSPG algorithm.
